00097 class ContentProvider {
00098   public:
00102     virtual ~ContentProvider();
00103 
00109     virtual bool onCreate() = 0;
00110 
00165     virtual storage::Cursor* queryN(const net::Uri& uri,
00166                                     const base::StringArray* const projection,
00167                                     const base::String* const selection,
00168                                     const base::StringArray* const selectionArgs,
00169                                     const base::String* const sortOrder) = 0;
00170 
00183     virtual base::String getType(const net::Uri& uri) = 0;
00184 
00195     virtual net::Uri insert(const net::Uri& uri,
00196                             const ContentValues& values) = 0;
00197 
00198     /* Override this to handle requests to insert a set of new rows, or the default
00199      * implementation will iterate over the values and call insert(Uri, ContentValues)
00200      * on each of them. As a courtesy, call notifyChange() after inserting.
00201      *
00202      * @param uri The content:// URI of the insertion request.
00203      * @param values An array of sets of column_name/value pairs to add to the database.
00204      *
00205      * @return The number of values that were inserted.
00206      */
00207     virtual int32_t bulkInsert(const gaia::net::Uri& uri,
00208                                const gaia::base::Array<ContentValues>& values);
00209 
00210     /* Override this to handle requests to open a file blob. The default implementation
00211      * always returns NULL.
00212      *
00213      * This method returns a ParcelFileDescriptor, which is returned directly to
00214      * the caller. This way large data (such as images and documents) can be returned
00215      * without copying the content.
00216      *
00217      * The returned ParcelFileDescriptor is owned by the caller, so it is their
00218      * responsibility to close it when done. That is, the implementation of this
00219      * method should create a new ParcelFileDescriptor for each call.
00220      *
00221      * @param uri The URI whose file is to be opened.
00222      * @param mode Access mode for the file. May be "r" for read-only access,
00223      * "rw" for read and write access, or "rwt" for read and write access that
00224      * truncates any existing file.
00225      *
00226      * @return a new ParcelFileDescriptor which you can use to access the file.
00227      */
00228     virtual gaia::storage::ParcelFileDescriptor* openFileN(
00229         const gaia::net::Uri& uri, const gaia::base::String& mode);
00230 
00250     virtual int32_t deleteData(const net::Uri& uri,
00251                                const base::String* const selection,
00252                                const base::StringArray* const selectionArgs) = 0;
00253 
00272     virtual int32_t update(const net::Uri& uri,
00273                            const content::ContentValues& values,
00274                            const base::String* const selection,
00275                            const base::StringArray* const selectionArgs) = 0;
00276 
00292     // TODO modify base::Array<ContentProviderOperation*> to base::Array<ContentProviderOperation>
00293     virtual ContentProviderResultArray applyBatch(
00294             const base::Array<ContentProviderOperation>& operations);
00295 
00307     virtual core::Persistence call(const base::String* const method,
00308                                    const base::String* const arg,
00309                                    const core::Persistence* const extras);
00310 
00312     bool attachInfo(core::Context* context, core::ProviderInfo* info);
00313     core::Context* getContext();
00314     ContentProviderProxy* getProxy() const;
00315     static ContentProvider* load(const char* packageName, const char* className);
